Nightly

Mina Protocol Nightly Debian Repository

Nightly builds for users who want to keep up with the newest Mina versions. Updated daily with latest development changes.

🌙 Nightly Package Information

Packages include build date in version format:

3.2.0-

where 3.2.0 is the latest version and is the date (YYYYMMDD)

Supported Distributions

  • Ubuntu Focal (20.04 LTS)
  • Ubuntu Noble (24.04 LTS)
  • Debian Bullseye (11)
  • Debian Bookworm (12)

Available Packages & Channels

Package Channel Debian Name
Mina Node Master mina
Mina Node Compatible mina-compatible
Mina Node Develop mina-develop
Archive Node All Channels mina-archive
Mina Rosetta Node Master mina-rosetta
Mina Rosetta Node Compatible mina-rosetta-compatible
Mina Rosetta Node Develop mina-rosetta-develop

Nightly Release Channels

Choose from compatible builds, critical patch releases, or cutting-edge development builds with the latest features.

⚡

Compatible

Network Compatible
Network Compatibility
Full
Hardfork Required
No
Risk Level
Low
Network-compatible nightly builds for safe testing. These packages are fully compatible with the current mainnet and devnet networks without requiring any hardfork or protocol changes. Perfect for testing new features while maintaining full network compatibility and ensuring seamless upgrades.
🔗 Network Compatible
Works with current mainnet and devnet without protocol changes
🚀 New Features
Latest performance improvements and feature additions
🔄 Seamless Upgrade
Drop-in replacement for stable versions without migration
📈 Production Testing
Safe for testing in production-like environments
🛡️

Master

Critical Patches
Patch Type
Critical
Network Target
Current
Risk Level
Medium
Critical early-access patches for current networks. These packages contain important security fixes, critical bug patches, and urgent updates that need early testing before being promoted to stable releases. Designed for current mainnet and devnet networks, providing essential fixes while maintaining network compatibility.
🛡️ Security Patches
Critical security fixes and vulnerability patches
⚡ Urgent Fixes
Important bug fixes for current network issues
📊 Early Testing
Test critical patches before stable release
🎯 Current Networks
Targeted for existing mainnet and devnet infrastructure
⚗️

Develop

Experimental
Network Compatibility
Limited
Hardfork Required
Possible
Risk Level
High
Cutting-edge development builds with potential breaking changes. These packages contain the latest experimental features and protocol modifications that may not be compatible with current mainnet or devnet networks. They might require hardfork upgrades and should only be used in isolated testing environments. Not recommended for production use.
🧪 Experimental Features
Latest protocol changes and experimental consensus mechanisms
⚠️ Breaking Changes
May be incompatible with current networks and require hardfork
🔬 Research Focus
Advanced cryptographic improvements and protocol research
🏗️ Future Protocol
Preview of upcoming protocol versions and network upgrades

Debian Installation Guide

To install Mina nightly packages through the APT repository, follow these steps:

1Import Debian Key (one-time setup)

Create a directory to store APT repository keys if it doesn't exist:

sudo install -d -m 0755 /etc/apt/keyrings

Import the Mina APT repository signing key:

wget -q https://nightly.packages.apt.minaprotocol.com/key.asc -O- | sudo tee /etc/apt/keyrings/nightly.packages.apt.minaprotocol.com.asc > /dev/null

If you don't have wget installed, install it first:

sudo apt-get install wget

Verify the key fingerprint (should be 35BAA0B33E9EB396F59CA838C0BA5CE6DC6315A3):

gpg -n -q --import --import-options import-show /etc/apt/keyrings/nightly.packages.apt.minaprotocol.com.asc | awk '/pub/{getline; gsub(/^ +| +$/,""); if($0 == "35BAA0B33E9EB396F59CA838C0BA5CE6DC6315A3") print "\nThe key fingerprint matches ("$0").\n"; else print "\nVerification failed for Mina nightly debian repo: the fingerprint ("$0") does not match the expected one.\n"}'

2Add Mina APT Repository (one-time setup)

Add the Mina nightly APT repository to your sources list:

echo "deb [signed-by=/etc/apt/keyrings/nightly.packages.apt.minaprotocol.com.asc] https://nightly.apt.packages.minaprotocol.com bullseye nightly" | sudo tee -a /etc/apt/sources.list.d/mina.nightly.list > /dev/null

3Prioritize Nightly Repository (one-time setup)

Configure APT to prioritize packages from the Mina nightly repository:

echo 'Package: * Pin: origin nightly.packages.apt.minaprotocol.com Pin-Priority: 1000 ' | sudo tee /etc/apt/preferences.d/mina-nightly

4Install Mina Package

Update your package list and install the desired Mina package:

sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install mina
